content: fuggle s critmas dice bag a very simple highly customisable treasure bag to be used for dice or other treasures a gift from one critter to another perfect for critmas inspired by the need to whip up a gift very quickly this can be knitted using any yarn you like we re holding three strands of yarn together here but you could use anything you re comfortable knitting with 4mm needles…of course you can change that too cast on is with a crochet hook it gives a lovely texture a little extra weight and bonus saves our wrists on those tiny circumferences who s fuggle you ask fuggle is a halfling a short but stout halfling fuggle has medium brown hair quite the beard and is particularly good at hiding you can find fuggle living in the woods with his brewing supplies at the foot of the highland mountains of his homeland fuggle is partial to a good ale in the local tavern preferably in the company of his adventuring friends if you should come across fuggle you ll certainly notice he s always got his pouch of hops at his side small with one cable small with two cables thank you for supporting independent design share your finished objects and see others on social media with the tags #heatherandhops for pattern support you can contact the and #fugglesdicebag #critmasdicebag designer at heatherandhopstv@gmail com please please do not reproduce or sell items find me on ravelry as heatherandhops that are knitted from this pattern without permission follow me on instagram @heather hops ©heather and hops 2020 all rights reserved page 1 of 5 fuggle s critmas dice bag recommended yarn yardage main colour holding three strands main colour holding three strands together fingering weight yarn e g heather together without a tie & hops yak 65% merino 20% silk 15% yak 32 42 56 g / 117 154 205 m / 128 168 224 120g -
